fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28437].
  {panel}

JIRA is an enterprise solution - can we please have to ability to specify custom validators/conditions and post functions?

Even with JIRA Toolkit, JIRA Suite Utilities and other common installed plugins, we are not able to do this.

E.g. if we wanted to restrict dates to only current/past dates, is there currently a validator for this?

It's also not possible to mark required fields - JIRA Suite Utilities can add this as a validator, but it's a major hack - it doesn't have the (*) and it shows ERROR in the logs. It's very confusing for end users.

What we need is at least basic functionality over this that is consistent and not functions from plugins here and there.

The current workaround is 3rd party plugins, e.g. Script Runner and/or Behaviour Plugin, but is a lot of work.

This applies especially to JIRA OnDemand due to the plugin policy.
fields.summary: Custom Validators/Conditions/Post Functions
Filter out issues in Road Map
Improve JIRA behaviour with NGINX proxy
Supported platforms addition - Unsupported anti virus
Write documentation on inline edit for plugin developers
JiraLockedError page returns a HTTP 200, when it should be a 500 class error
Show Affects version together with Fix version
Issue search doesn't show the 'Views' menu when there are no issues
Allow post functions to change values of Custom Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28420].
  {panel}

h4. Actual behavior: 

JIRA is adding the _Catch Email Address_ as a Watcher of an Issue when the E-mail Address belongs to some JIRA User and the Mail Handler has *CC Watcher* enabled. Leading to a possible Mail Loop.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Project and associate with the _Default Notification Scheme_;
# Add an Incoming Mail Server and Add a Mail Handler that has the CC Watcher enabled and set a _Catch Email Address_ the same as one JIRA User.
# Send an e-mail to that address.
# JIRA will create the issue and add the _Catch Email Address_ address as one of the watchers.

h4. Expected behavior:

JIRA should not add the user in the watchers list.

h4. Notes:
# This is affecting JIRA Service Desk Email Settings as well, in this case it is the request participants.
# Tested on JIRA Core 7.0.2 and without the "Catch Email Address". If there is a user with the same email address as in "To" of a sent email, it will added as a watcher.

h4. Workaround:

Modify the user email address or the Catch Email Address being used.
fields.summary: Catch Email Address added as a Watcher when CC Watcher is on
The JIRA bamboo plugin always show in the list of available plugins updates despite been updated

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28411].
  {panel}

I have a problem with allowing people to convert the normal issue to subtask.

According to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/EHSP-29889, I got confirmation that the person who is able to do that must have *Edit Issue* permission. 

From my point of view, people who has the permission of creating issue may want organize the issue by themselves like converting their issue to subtask of the another issue, but they may not have permission of editing issue.

Therefore, please add more role or permission for covert the issue separately.
fields.summary: Please add more role or permission for convert the issue

fields.description:
Looks like JIRA does not support project level isolation, can you let me know how I can accomplish this task with JIRA? 

We would like each project to be separate and each team member will only be able to see the projects they have been assigned to, and they only see team members have been assigned to the same project when assigning an owner. 

I have tried to change the 'browse projects' option but apparently these projects got disappeared from the list, no one can see it unless admin. 

Can you help? 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Not able to manage project level permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28397].
  {panel}

We're setting up a Disaster Recovery (DR) Server for JIRA. 

We've managed the File System Sync.

When i tried syncing the databases of the 2 instances using a 3rd party tool (Navicat). It worked fine, all the issues were in-sync. However, when I tried syncing the oracle archive logs (using Oracle DataGuard) and tried to start the DR-JIRA Server. It started off as a new installation! The logs said that none of the tables were present. 

I had previously restored a backup of JIRA before syncing the databases and on the Database CLI said that both databases were in sync.

Any ideas on why this is happening?

Saneth
fields.summary: Syncing JIRA Databases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28392].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce (Scenario A)

* Setup a fresh installation of JIRA
* At the first step of the [set up wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA050/Running+the+Setup+Wizard], choose a language pack other than English such as German
* Finish the setup and create issues
* Go to the general configuration page and change the default language to English
* *(BUG)* The dashboard will still be mixed with both English and German language see screenshot

h3. How to reproduce (Scenario B)

* Start JIRA from a clean instance
* Create two users: One with the default language and one with a different locale than the system default (For example: Japanese or Spanish)
* Make sure that the system default locale is set to English(UK)
* Shutdown Jira and Restart
* Login into jira with the Japanese user
* Go to the dashboard. Make sure that the assigned to me gadget shows no issues assigned
* Login again with the default language user
* *(BUG)* Go to the dashboard, you will see the "No issues assigned" text in Japanese.

h3. Workaround

- Restart JIRA, or in JIRA Administration "Refresh Client Resources" (System> User Interface > Look and Feel) and make sure that the language of the first user to browse the JIRA dashboard gadgets is the same as the system's default language.

h3. Root Cause Analysis

This is caused by the way JIRA includes {{web-resources}} into the gadget's XML specification.

Currently, when JIRA is started all gadget specifications available in {{gadget}} plugin modules are retrieved, then we proceed to resolve a number of Atlassian specific directives (see https://developer.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/Using+Substitution+Variables+and+Directives+in+your+Gadget) and then the transformed xml specification is validated and cached for later use.

At this stage, web resources are included via two of these directives, specifically {{#requireResource}} and {{#includeResources}}. This happens at {{GadgetProcessorImpl.processIncludeResources}} and web resource urls are generated per each included resource. The URl needs to include the locale as part of the resource to fetch, so since this is done at start-up this will be the system default language at that moment.

This is the wrong time to do this as: 

# All users will then get the cached transformed copy of the gadget spec xml which will specify inclusion of resources using the default language.
# If the language of the first user to request a gadget is not the system default language (used to resolve the urls to the included resources) any call to  {{AJS.getText()}} or soy's {{getText}} function will be done under the current user's language, which will then cause the included resources for the default language to be cached with i18n strings in the _wrong_ language. 

The second problem is more severe as it will affect any part of the UI that makes use of the resources corrupted with the i18n messages in the wrong language.
fields.summary: The language translation got mixed up in the dashboard after choosing a default language other than the chosen one from initialization
Get back status update on mail subject

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28384].
  {panel}

Using a physical Kanban board with stickie-notes, eventually the stickie-notes will "decay" and fall off the board.  A great indication that the ticket has been sitting on the board for way too long, and obviously it wasn't important enough to become urgent.

What if JIRA had a similar "decay" feature, where you can configure the 'half-life' of different classifications of issues...and these items that have decayed, or became stale, fall into a pane on the bottom of your screen that you can drag open - similar to a pile of stickie-notes that have fallen onto the floor.

The neat thing about this is, if an item has been stuck in a state that isn't an "end-point" (closed, open, etc.), then the status changes to the stale status and can be found easily in the slide-out pane at the bottom of the window.

You could do really neat things with this as well, like run reports on how many items become stale; easily communicate a list of items that need to be triaged/addressed; and also you have a way to visualize the items that aren't getting any attention.

It's somewhat of a cheek feature, but I think there is value in being able to quickly/easily visualize the work that is being abandoned.  It will help the development teams so that the backlog doesn't get cluttered with items that never die...and it will help managers to make certain that items are walking through the process properly.

Let me know if you have any questions.
Thank you for building such awesome products!
-
Matt Terry
mcterry@sep.com
fields.summary: Request to add a new "decay" feature for JIRA issues...
Allow Shared Dashboards to Have Multiple Owners

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28379].
  {panel}

The OnDemand Importer has logic in {{StudioImporterFacade#postImportStudify()}} to massage freshly imported config data into the shape required by OnDemand environment.

If the import process fails after the data import but before this "post-import Studify" step, the instance configuration is corrupt, in such a way that customers cannot log in.

The workaround to re-enable access to customer admins is to correct the base URL, and manually ensure the Global Permissions refer to groups that exist on OnDemand (for example, replace {{jira-administrators}} with {{administrators}}). The customer admin may then re-run an import, and the instance should be OK if this second import completes successfully.

This seems to be rare, but the impact is severe. Failures I have seen that have caused this are:
- A badly timed PermGen exhaustion.
- The following exception (not sure what the underlying cause is):
{noformat}
2012-05-23 18:19:25,932 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR rfernandes 1098x7022x1 970isl 59.167.133.3,59.167.133.70 /secure/admin/StudioImport!import.jspa [jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalStateException: It is illegal to call the ServiceManager before all components are loaded. Please use interface com.atlassian.jira.extension.Startable to get notified when JIRA has started.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: It is illegal to call the ServiceManager before all components are loaded. Please use interface com.atlassian.jira.extension.Startable to get notified when JIRA has started.
      at com.atlassian.jira.service.DefaultServiceManager.ensureServicesLoaded(DefaultServiceManager.java:301)
      at com.atlassian.jira.service.DefaultServiceManager.getServices(DefaultServiceManager.java:81)
      at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.getServices(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:170)
      at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.ensureSingleService(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:524)
      at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.checkMailListenerAndService(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:385)
      at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.checkDataConsistency(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:224)
      at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.checkConsistency(DefaultDataImportService.java:653)
      at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:564)
      at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:222)
      at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.call(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:97)
      at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.call(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:1)
      at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:147)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
      at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:441)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
      at com.atlassian.multitenant.impl.DefaultMultiTenantManager.runForTenant(DefaultMultiTenantManager.java:61)
      at com.atlassian.multitenant.juc.MultiTenantExecutors$WrappedRunnable.run(MultiTenantExecutors.java:160)
      at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
      at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
      at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{noformat}
fields.summary: OnDemand Importer may fail after data import but before "post-import Studify", resulting in a corrupt instance.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28349].
  {panel}

Recently we tightened up security in all JIRA OnDemand instances by not allowing arbitrary HTML in custom field descriptions. We fixed this vulnerability by only allowing plain text or [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all].

We would like to come up with a secure compromise if possible that still allows customers to accomplish what they were previously using the custom field descriptions for. In order for that to happen we would like to know how you were using custom field descriptions by asking you to comment on this issue.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA OnDemand Product Manager
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand custom field descriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28344].
  {panel}

Essential features like managing versions of a project are inaccessible with browsers, who have their local dom storage disabled for security reasons.

h3. Steps to reproduce
- Open Firefox and navigate to "about:config" 
- Filter for {{dom.storage.enabled}} and set it to {{false}} by double-clicking the entry 
- Open JIRA and try to manage project versions or updating your Avatar image. \\ Certainly many more functions are affected as well

h3. Error
- Instead of displaying the screen to manage your versions the UI only presents the "Please wait indicator" overlay.
- The JavaScript console display the following entry {code}
localStorage is null
https://www.exxcellent.de/jira/s/en_UKw6luo9/731/6/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js
Line 389
{code}
- The UI is fully blocked by the "please wait" overlay and no longer usable 

h3. Desired resolution
JIRA must not blindly assume, that the local DOM storage is available. 
HTML5 features like these may be inaccessible due to a variety of security/browser/other limitations.
fields.summary: Support running in browsers with local DOM storage disabled
Allow multiple owners for a dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28339].
  {panel}

Ability to create a number of filters in Jira.
For example:
All open ticket were I or one of my team members are BPO.
All open ticket were I or one of my team members are BPM.
All open tickets within a certain Process Area, such as Inventory Management.
All open tickets within a certain Component, such as Distribution.

Today it is extremely difficult to create these kind of filter's which are required for monitoring and follow-up. Instead personal excel tables are maintained on local PC's in order to review open tickets.
fields.summary: Improve Jira task filtering for Sandvik users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28334].
  {panel}

Currently SSL and Proxy are two of the more difficult configurations to setup on JIRA. It would be great to reduce the difficulty of this by enhancing the JIRA Configuration Tool so that it handles the setup of these. Already we have a fairly large amount of documentation that could be reduced with this functionality built in, for example:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Apache+Reverse+Proxy+Using+the+AJP+Protocol
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+IIS

And looking at the number of KBs we have to cater for these:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/label/JIRAKB/ssl -> 12
http://confluence.atlassian.com/label/JIRAKB/apache -> 20
http://confluence.atlassian.com/label/JIRAKB/iis -> 3

For example, you could add a SSL and a Proxy tab to the configuration tool, or put them all in the Web Server tab, wherever fits best. This would then allow something like the following for SSL:

# Select the SSL tab.
# Select the location of the certificate.
# Enter the certificate alias, if applicable.
# Select the desired keystore (cacerts/user specific).
# Enter the HTTPS port.
# Select whether or not you wish to force HTTPS.
# Hit the apply button.

This would then execute the appropriate keytool command to import the certificate using the path provided, update the {{server.xml}} and also modify the {{WEB-INF/web.xml}} if they want to force HTTPS.It could also provide an appropriate description of any errors if they arise.

For proxy, something like this would be ideal:

# Select the proxy tab.
# Select the proxy type (mod_proxy or AJP).
# Enter the HTTPS port.
# Enter the AJP port (if applicable).
# Select whether or not HTTPS is being offloaded at the reverse-proxy.
# Enter the base URL.
# Enter the JIRA server IP.
# Hit Apply.

This would then:

# Parse the base URL and determine if a {{context}} path needs to be set in {{server.xml}} (as in [Configure JIRA's application server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache#IntegratingJIRAwithApache-Step1ConfigureJIRAsapplicationserver]).
# Add the {{proxyPort}}, {{scheme}} and {{proxyPath}} attributes to the connector in {{server.xml}} (these values will vary depending on the settings, as in [Alternative configuration if HTTPS is terminated on the proxy server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL#IntegratingJIRAwithApacheusingSSL-NoteAlternativeconfigurationifHTTPSisterminatedontheproxyserver] and [Troubleshooting|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache#IntegratingJIRAwithApache-Troubleshooting].
# If you want to be super awesome, generate the block of text that the user will need to copy/paste into their VirtualHost configuration. For example:
{code:title=VirtualHost}

<Proxy *>
Order deny,allow
Allow from all
</Proxy>

ProxyRequests       	Off
ProxyPreserveHost 	On

SSLEngine		On <-- based on whether or not terminating SSL

ProxyPass 		/${context_path}	[ajp|http|https]://${JIRA IP}:${ajp or JIRA port}/${context_path}
ProxyPassReverse 	/${context_path}	[ajp|http|https]://${JIRA IP}:${ajp or JIRA port}/${context_path}
{code}

This would be *incredibly* useful.
fields.summary: Enhance the JIRA Configuration Tool so that it can handle the setup of SSL and proxies

Here is a related [issue|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-126908].

Kindly regards,

Paulo Renato
Atlassian support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28314].
  {panel}

Currently, the bulk edit feature displays default fields and doesn't align with the screens or fields that have been setup for the instance. 

Consequently, there are fields being displayed on bulk edit that are not accessible to edit or view when working with the issue.  This can lead to both confusion as well as orphaned data -- user modifies a field during bulk edit that they will never be able to view or change. 

Either provide the ability to configure fields by project that are only available for bulk editing or allow the screens configuration to drive what the user can bulk edit. 

We definitely need it by project since our projects are very different and have very different screen schemes since we use Jira throughout our development, sales, support, and implementation depts.
fields.summary: Configure bulk edit options to avoid confusion

Rumi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28305].
  {panel}

If I create a story, but don't assign an epic to it, then I create a few sub-tasks, then I assign an epic to only the story, the sub-tasks won't have the epic assigned. 

Because the view of an epic with all of its stories and tasks only shows the ones with the epic assigned, and - here's the real problem - the estimates that roll up to the epic don't include the unaffiliated tasks.

(1) Ideally, when assigning an epic theme to a story, I have the option to cascade it to the children of that story.
(2) When adding new tasks to a story with an epic theme, it would be nice if they would auto-adopt the story's epic theme.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the option of bulk applying an epic theme to all child elements and their children in order to have correct aggregated data at the epic level
Redirect from searchrequest.html page to login screen
can you create a way to limit the amount of information displayed to a user when an unhandled exception occurs?
Option to disable concurrent logins in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28292].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to any issue and with the dot dialog choose Move
# When on the move page, press and hold the back button.

Note that the title displayed in the back button is not the title of the issue you came from rather "Operations - " then the project name.
fields.summary: Title of window is incorrect when going Back to a page which had a dialog displayed
Default Attachment sort order
'Use Default Directory' option in JIRA backup service
Please upgrade JSU plugin to 1.2.4 in JOD

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28283].
  {panel}

Currently when you sort by versions in the issue navigator, JIRA only checks/sorts by the first version, see here:
!^sort version.png|thumbnail!

It'd be nice if JIRA would also consider the sub-versions when sorting.

Example for the above screenshot:
{code}
version1
version1
version1
version1, version2
version1, version2
version1, version2, version3
version1, version3
version1, version3
version2
version2, version3
version2, version3
version3
version3
{code}
fields.summary: Improve version sorting
Improve the way to relocate an App Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28277].
  {panel}

Hi all,

I have a project called Marketing and multiple issue types; Strategy, Marketing, Planning. Depending on the issue type selected I want to be able to display a different list of values for a field called Area. So for example if Marketing is the issue type, Area would have the vlaues Market Problem, Competitive Landscape and Technology Assessment, but if the Issue type is Strategy the Aread field would have the values Market Definition, Distribution Strategy...

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Custom Field values depending on the Issue Type
Trying to log-in with cookies disabled gives no warning to the user
Timesheet Gadget: sticky summary column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28271].
  {panel}

Hi, we recently ran into this problem.
A user has edited his profile details, by changing "email address" field.
He entered TWO email addres separated by semicolon (e.g. "foo@bar.com; bar@foo.com").
From that moment all the notification emails to his profile where blocked in Mail Error Queue (because of the invalid email address).
I know that Jira doesn't support multiple email addresses per user, but it would be nice to tell to the user that the email addres he entered is invalid.

Thanks,
Davide.
fields.summary: Validate user email address
Improve the Issue Navigator Search and Quick Search
Provide administrators the ability to disable or default autowatch
Integrate with Sugarsync
Add Error Message to Create Issue Screen
When a Validator prevents the "Create" transition, the Create Issue dialog does not scroll to the error message
basicMode is not implemented when editing customfield contexts
Ability to query list of issues that are resolved before the due date
Performing Text Searches Documentation
Getting 'Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-public' on my Unicorn instance.
Getting 'Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-public' on my Unicorn instance.
Share button shows users that are disabled
ActiveObjects proxy should expose getters for FieldNameConverter, TableNameConverter

  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Start an import (gg > "Restore System").

fields.summary: Stack trace when accessing the error page during an import
Summary highlighted when edit an issue
make JQL auto-complete slightly smarter for fixVersion
Turn on 'Source' and 'Reviews' only when Project App Link is created
Possibility to rename a gadget title by your own

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28234].
  {panel}

Comments are not reported in the changelog of an issue while for instance, worklogs or attachments are reported.

My application check for updates on issues via the rest API.
Right now I have to check worklogs and comments.
It would be nice to only have to retrieve the worklogs to get all updates.
fields.summary: With the REST API, comments are not reported in the changelog of an issue.
